title: Support shared first place when winners tie on score

requirements.text: Update the game-end result model to support multiple winners (a tie) instead of only a single `winner`, and ensure the scoring utilities can return all tied players when applicable.

quotes: If there is a tie for Lois score then the players tie for first place

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/lib/scoring.ts` no longer limits game-end results to a single winner when a tie occurs.
When the winning condition is met and multiple players share the winning score, the game-end result includes all tied players (not just the first one).
No TypeScript errors in callers due to the updated result type.

requirements.text: Update the game-over UI on the score sheet to correctly display ties for first place: if multiple winners are returned, show all tied player names and indicate they are tied for first place with the winning score.

quotes: If there is a tie for Lois score then the players tie for first place

acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/screens/ScoreSheetScreen.tsx`, when the game is ended and multiple winners exist, the UI renders messaging that indicates a tie for first place (in English).
When exactly one winner exists, the UI continues to show the existing single-winner message.
The standings list remains unchanged and continues to render all players and totals.

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only UI component sources).
Keep changes within the existing React + TypeScript + React Query + Tailwind stack; no new backend services.
nonGoals: Implementing Phase 10 scoring, phase tracking, or end-of-game logic (only tie-handling behavior for winners is in scope for this request).
Adding game history storage or persistence changes.
